DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Slide Epithelial Cell Count Neoplasm Nucleus Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The percentage of tumor epithelial cell nuclei as compared to all cell nuclei.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Slide Device Component Epithelial Cell Count Neoplasm Nucleus Percentage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study._One of the cells that cover the surface of the body and line its cavities._A procedure to determine the number of cells in a sample. Also used to mean the result of such a procedure._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._A body within the cell, surrounded by a membrane, within which lie the chromosomes, one or more nucleoli, combined with proteins, and exhibits mitosis._A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Slide Device Component Epithelial Cell Cell Count Neoplasm Nucleus Percentage
Property.preferredDefinition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.:One of the cells that cover the surface of the body and line its cavities.:A procedure to determine the number of cells in a sample. Also used to mean the result of such a procedure.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:A body within the cell, surrounded by a membrane, within which lie the chromosomes, one or more nucleoli, combined with proteins, and exhibits mitosis.:A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

Concepts.definition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.
Any of the cells of the epithelium, which covers the body and lines its cavities and glands.
A procedure to determine the number of cells in a sample.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
A body within the cell, surrounded by a membrane, within which lie the chromosomes, one or more nucleoli, combined with proteins, and exhibits mitosis.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed as a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Percent of tumor nuclei by ce
